about_the_game:
Bingo Pinball Gameroom is a collection of 80 extremely realistic Bingo Pinball simulations, amusement machines that were very popular in the 50s to mid 70s. Although officially 'for amusement only', used for gambling nevertheless. Eventually banned in many states all over the world. They proved to be too addictive, too dangerous.

Those who know Bingo Pinballs – maybe even had the chance to play them – will appreciate the realistic gameplay. Those who don't know them may be surprized: at first glance it looks just a kind of flipper pinball. But they will soon realize that to score the highest wins, hard decisions have to be made with many possible strategies to follow. No, there's no money involved in the simulations, but can prove to be very addictive still. And no, they have nothing to do with that other bingo game, often played in senior homes...

  • Look and feel of original Bingo Pinball machines
  • All sounds sampled from real Bally and United Bingos
  • Large, crisp graphics
  • Built-in support for multi-screen Virtual Cabinets (using PinballX, Pinup Popper or any other frontend software)
  • Interface to connect to a real Bingo Cabinet
  • Available for Windows and Apple OSX
  • Bally Show Time included, free to play

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: High Sierra (10.13.6)
  • Processor: Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Monterey (12.6.3)
  • Processor: Core i5
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

name: Bingo Pinball Gameroom

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: core i5
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Recommended
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or higher
  • Processor: core i5
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Recommended
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: A collection of 80 Bingo Pinball simulations. Discover why people became addicted to these mysterious machines in the past. 'For amusement only', but used for gambling nevertheless. Too dangerous, so eventually banned in many states. Start right away: Bally Show Time is included, free to use!
